sentence.Network_en: A peaceable settlement has been reached.
John was always so extraordinarily peaceable, one who invariably saw an opponent's point of view.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰总是非常温和，总是能够顾及反对者的意见。

sentence.Network_en: He has lived a peaceable and honest life.
sentence.Network_cn: 他安分守己,老老实实地生活着.

means.word_mean: 平和的,息事宁人的,爱好和平的,安静的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French peisible, alteration of plaisible, from late Latin placibilis 'pleasing', from Latin placere 'to please'

entry.def: Someone who is peaceable tries to avoid quarrelling or fighting with other people.

example.ex: ...an attempt by ruthless  people to impose their will on a peaceable majority...
example.tran: 残忍无道的人将其意志强加给大多数平和的人的企图

example.ex: John was always so extraordinarily peaceable, one who invariably saw an opponent's point of view.
example.tran: 约翰总是非常温和，总是能够顾及反对者的意见。

means.word_mean: 2. disposed to peace or of a peaceful nature;

sentences.sentence: "the pacific temper seeks to settle disputes on grounds of justice rather than by force"
